name: Good Grief Quiz / Test | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: What is the name of the magic magazine that Gob has in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Poof.

	The volume of Poof that Gob has talks about a magician who baked himself into a loaf of bread, and later popped out of a sandwich to entertain the troops.  Gob said that he had nearly the same idea, only instead, he'd be boiled in a lot of chowder, and be ladled into a cauldron to entertain firefighters.

Party planner.

	Lucille ends up calling Michael at the office to tell him that the family's bounty hunter, Ice, as found George Sr.  Ice tells them that he wants to get paid before he tells them the whereabouts of their father, and he ends up throwing a small party.

questions.text: Barry Zuckerkorn lost George Sr.'s will.
questions.explanation:
True.

	After Ice tells the family that George Sr. has been killed, Lucille demands to know where the will is, and Barry, covering his mistake up, says that the will is in his office next to the hot plate with the frayed wires.  Maeby on the other hand, tries to hook her mom up with Ice in order to get an emancipation.

questions.text: What was the name of the Bluth family's old housekeeper?
questions.explanation:
Rosa.

	Back when Buster was younger, his parakeet landed on Rosa's wig, and flew away when she was outside taking out the trash.  Unluckily, it flew into a transformer, and Buster ended up making a huge mess in the kitchen since he assumed that Rosa lived there.

questions.text: Who helps Gob with his magic trick?
questions.explanation:
Buster.

	Gob decides to attempt a new trick in order to be in Poof Magazine, and he decides to do it during George Sr.'s funeral.  In the trick, Gob gets into a coffin and locks it, then Buster spins it around.  After this, Gob goes out the trap door in the back, closes it, and everyone buries an empty coffin.

questions.text: Who is the first to find George Sr.?
questions.explanation:
George Michael.

	After Ann breaks up with George Michael, he goes home depressed.  After Michael breaks the news that George Sr. is dead, he decides to tell his dad that he was the one that broke up with Ann in order to make sure that he doesn't have any more stress.  After this, George Michael walks to the adjoining lot next to the model home and trips over a hatch.  When he opens it, he finds George Sr.

questions.text: What is the name of the toothpaste that George Sr. uses?
questions.explanation:
Glisten.

	Lindsay makes this comment when Ice hands her the dental records at Lucille's apartment, and George Sr. mentions it again after George Michael finds him.  After discovering his secret location, George Michael helps George Sr. hide in the attic.

questions.text: What is written inside the birthday card that Buster buys for George Sr.?
questions.explanation:
See you soon.

	After continuing to assume that George Sr. is still alive and well, Buster goes and buys a card for him.  After Gob tells him that the coffin trick is supposed to be dark humour, Buster pics out a card with a picture of the grim reaper on the inside saying "See you soon".  During the funeral, George Sr. watches from the attic window.

questions.text: Does Michael find out that George Sr. is alive?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	George Michael ends up telling his father that he had George Sr. in the attic, but Michael doesn't believe him.  After Gob's failed magic trick, Michael realizes that George Sr. is still alive when he finds an empty box of Glisten, and he confronts him in the attic.

questions.text: Who does not sulk at least once during this episode?
questions.explanation:
Michael.

	This episode contains numerous references to Charlie Brown.  The first is when George Michael and Ann break up, and he walks home sulking.  In the background, you can see a spotted dog lying on top of a red doghouse.  George Sr. sulks in Mexico, Tobias at the model home, and Gob in the office when he appears as Poof Magazine's goof of the year.  Every time someone sulks, a song from "Charlie Brown" plays, and the title of this episode, "Good Grief", is a reference to Charlie Brown's famous line.
